definitions.definition: A large body of ice which flows under its own mass, usually downhill.
examples: They warned that the effects of glacier melting on water resources are becoming “increasingly serious” for China.

definitions.definition: An area of a mountain where snow is present year-round.
examples: You can ski down the glacier in both the winter and the summer.

main_definition: ( geology ) A large body of ice which flows under its own mass, usually downhill.
secondary_definitions: ( mountaineering ) An area of a mountain where snow is present year-round.
